answers.answer: Hi, I had pregnancy hypertension my entire pregnancy.  For preeclampsia, they look for things like protein in the urine.  My hypertension or high blood pressure never went to preeclampsia and I delivered that baby 10 days past his due date.  I did not have high blood pressure in my next pregnancy.  Does that help?

Symtoms are high bp, seeing stars, bad headaches all the time, swelling in hands and face, protein in urine. If you make sure to have at least 90grams of protein a day your chances at getting it are very small. A study was done that proves it is caused by not enough protein and the women who had 90grams did not get it.

I have a mild case of it. And I'm 39 weeks! I found out Friday. I go back to the doctor Monday and if my blood pressure is still high them I will have to be induced or else my baby could die and I can too. Buy everything will be okay. I changed my eating habits. You should too and drink lots of water and get plenty of sleep. Try not to stress ! :] good luck

I had with my first at 28wks, they managed it until 35wks and then delivered. This time I developed it at 15wks. They were managing it ok until I went into preterm labour at 27wks. They managed to stop it 3times and iI'm now 31wks, hopefully will make it to my csection at 36wks. Depending on how high the protein is they can manage the symptoms for a while with different bp meds, calcium, aspirin, and a low fat diet.
Ok thanks ladies. I feel better now. I was a little worried.

question: Can someone ease my mind about this?? Not sure if I have it yet. But had to go to the hospital the other day for high blood pressure.
title: preeclampsia
